title: Maximum Drawdown (MDD)
content:
# Maximum Drawdown (MDD)

MDD measures the largest peak-to-trough decline in the value of a portfolio (before a new peak is achieved). It represents the worst-case scenario for an investor who bought at the top and sold at the bottom.

## Calculation
1.  Calculate Cumulative Returns (Wealth Index).
2.  Calculate Running Maximum (High Water Mark).
3.  Calculate Drawdown = (Wealth Index - High Water Mark) / High Water Mark.
4.  MDD = Minimum of Drawdown.
code:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

returns = pd.Series([0.01, 0.02, -0.05, -0.05, 0.10, 0.02])
wealth_index = (1 + returns).cumprod()
previous_peaks = wealth_index.cummax()

drawdown = (wealth_index - previous_peaks) / previous_peaks
mdd = drawdown.min()

print("Wealth Index:\n", wealth_index.values)
print("Drawdown:\n", drawdown.values)
print(f"Max Drawdown: {mdd:.2%}")
